Title: KISTERS QueryServices - Request Information
Text: All commands are available as HTTP GET and POST (add ?kvp=true to URL!) with key-value-pair encoding.

getGroupList.Description: Retrieves a list of object groups.

tabjson.Name: tabjson
tabjson.Description: JSON format to reflect table structure

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

ca_group.Name: ca_group
ca_group.Description: returns custom group attributes, optionally use parameter ca_group_returnfields to select specific fields

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

ca_group_returnfields.Name: ca_group_returnfields
ca_group_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined group attributes (md_returnfield 'ca_group' must be active, allows comma separated list)

addlinks.Name: addlinks
addlinks.Description: adds links for easier data discovery to the response

includeprivate.Name: includeprivate
includeprivate.Description: set to false to ignore private groups; default is true

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

getSiteList.Description: Retrieves a list of sites with metadata.

bbox.Name: bbox
bbox.Description: comma separated list with four values in order min_x, min_y, max_x, max_y; use 'crs' parameter to choose between local and global coordinates

tabjson.Name: tabjson
tabjson.Description: JSON format to reflect table structure

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

site_type_name.Name: site_type_name
site_type_name.Description: Site type, e.g. 'Surface Water'; Multiple values are concatenated with ; as separator

site_type_shortname.Name: site_type_shortname
site_type_shortname.Description: Site type shortname; Multiple values are concatenated with ; as separator

site_area_wkt.Name: site_area_wkt
site_area_wkt.Description: the WKT string of the site extent if set

site_area_wkt_org.Name: site_area_wkt_org
site_area_wkt_org.Description: the original WKT string of the site extent if set

ca_site.Name: ca_site
ca_site.Description: returns custom site attributes, optionally use parameter ca_site_returnfields to select specific fields

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

crs.Name: crs
crs.Description: select which coordinates should be used for bbox filtering, possible values are 'local' and 'global'; default is global

ca_site_returnfields.Name: ca_site_returnfields
ca_site_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined site attributes (returnfield 'ca_site' must be active, allows comma separated list)

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

addlinks.Name: addlinks
addlinks.Description: adds links for easier data discovery to the response

orderby.Name: orderby
orderby.Description: Sort the response by one of the following fields: site_name, site_longname, site_no, site_id

getStationList.Description: Retrieves a list of stations with metadata.

bbox.Name: bbox
bbox.Description: comma separated list with four values in order min_x, min_y, max_x, max_y; use 'crs' parameter to choose between local and global coordinates

fulltext.Name: fulltext
fulltext.Description: fulltext filter for all station metadata fields

custattrfilter.Name: custattrfilter
custattrfilter.Description: filter for one ore more custom station attributes in the form 'key1:value1;key2:value2;...'

tabjson.Name: tabjson
tabjson.Description: JSON format to reflect table structure

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

kml.Name: kml
kml.Description: Keyhole Markup Language by Google and OGC

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

object_type.Name: object_type
object_type.Description: Station type, e.g. 'Surface Water'; Multiple values are concatenated with ; as separator

object_type_shortname.Name: object_type_shortname
object_type_shortname.Description: Station type shortname; Multiple values are concatenated with ; as separator

station_area_wkt.Name: station_area_wkt
station_area_wkt.Description: the WKT string of the station extent if set

station_area_wkt_org.Name: station_area_wkt_org
station_area_wkt_org.Description: the original WKT string of the station extent if set

ca_site.Name: ca_site
ca_site.Description: returns custom site attributes, optionally use parameter ca_site_returnfields to select specific fields

ca_sta.Name: ca_sta
ca_sta.Description: returns custom station attributes, optionally use parameter ca_sta_returnfields to select specific fields

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

crs.Name: crs
crs.Description: select which coordinates should be used for bbox filtering, possible values are 'localxy', 'regional' and 'global'; default is global; KML and LPK format will need global coordinates

ca_site_returnfields.Name: ca_site_returnfields
ca_site_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined site attributes (returnfield 'ca_site' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_sta_returnfields.Name: ca_sta_returnfields
ca_sta_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined station attributes (returnfield 'ca_sta' must be active, allows comma separated list)

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

flatten.Name: flatten
flatten.Description: if true, the list will be flattened to contain one station per station_id, all parameter and the object_type fields will be concatenated per entry; default is false

addlinks.Name: addlinks
addlinks.Description: adds links for easier data discovery to the response

orderby.Name: orderby
orderby.Description: Sort the response by one of the following fields: station_name, site_name, object_type_shortname, site_no, object_type, station_id, site_id, station_longname, catchment_id, catchment_name, station_no, catchment_no

getRatingCurveList.Description: Retrieves a list of rating curves.
getRatingCurveList.Subdescription: The following combinations of time periods can be requested:;from + to: will return curves for the requested range;from + period: will return curves for the given period starting at the from date;to + period: will return curves for the given period backdating from the to date;period: will return curves for the given period backdating from the current system time;period=complete: will return all curves;from: will return all curves valid at the given from date until the current system time;to: will return all curves valid until the given to date;/: not providing any time filter will return all currently valid curves;

station_id.Name: station_id
station_id.Description: filter for one or more station IDs; either station_id, stationgroup_id or a source/target combination can be used

stationgroup_id.Name: stationgroup_id
stationgroup_id.Description: filter for a station group; either station_id, stationgroup_id or a source/target combination can be used

source.Name: source
source.Description: filter for the rating curve source, use a list of either site_no/station_no or site_no/station_no/stationparameter_no paths; either station_id, stationgroup_id or a source/target combination can be used

target.Name: target
target.Description: optionally filter for the rating curve target, use a list of either site_no/station_no or site_no/station_no/stationparameter_no paths; if present, must have the same count of entries as source; either station_id, stationgroup_id or a source/target combination can be used

from.Name: from
from.Description: see date formats, not providing 'from' delivers the last ts value only

to.Name: to
to.Description: see date formats, using yyyy-MM-dd as format includes the complete given day

period.Name: period
period.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar; as an alternative period can be set to 'complete' to return all data

name.Name: name
name.Description: optionally filter for the rating curve name

group.Name: group
group.Description: optionally filter for the rating curve group

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

stepsize.Name: stepsize
stepsize.Description: The step size for the rating values, defaults to 1.0; step size overrules steps

steps.Name: steps
steps.Description: The step count for the rating values; step size overrules steps

includeratingtable.Name: includeratingtable
includeratingtable.Description: optionally set this to false to only return the metadata of rating curves but not the actual values; default is true

eta.Name: eta
eta.Description: optional parameter to adjust the values for anomalies, valid range from 0.0 to 1.0

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

getStationLithology.Description: Retrieves a list of lithology layers for a station.

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

includefillings.Name: includefillings
includefillings.Description: setting this to true will include the fillings per layer, default is false; will be ignored for format gwml2

order.Name: order
order.Description: sets the order in which the layers will be returned by depth, asc/ascending or desc/descending; default is ascending; will be ignored for format gwml2

csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

all.Name: all
all.Description: set this parameter to return all available fields

groupby1.Description: objson format only - groups response list by the given field as sub object in the json; all returnfields can be used

groupby2.Name: groupby2
groupby2.Description: objson format only - groups response list already grouped by groupby1 by the given field as second level sub objects in the json; all returnfields can be used

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

dateformat.Description: the date format that will be returned, see date formats

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be returned for all timestamps, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET)

getTimeseriesList.Description: Retrieves a list of timeseries with metadata.

ts_path.Name: ts_path
ts_path.Description: The timeseries path as definied in WISKI7 - 'site_no/station_no/stationparameter_no/ts_shortname'; A single path can be used with wildcards, or a comma seperated list of paths without wildcards; using the ts_path filter disables all other filters

stationgroup_id.Name: stationgroup_id
stationgroup_id.Description: Cannot be used together with other id or path filters

fulltext.Name: fulltext
fulltext.Description: fulltext filter for all timeseries metadata fields

tabjson.Name: tabjson
tabjson.Description: JSON format to reflect table structure

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

kml.Name: kml
kml.Description: Keyhole Markup Language by Google and OGC

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

ts_path.Name: ts_path
ts_path.Description: The timeseries path as definied in WISKI7 - 'site_no/station_no/stationparameter_no/ts_shortname'

coverage.Name: coverage
coverage.Description: will add from/to values of the data coverage

ts_density.Name: ts_density
ts_density.Description: will add an estimation of how many values this timeseries theoretically has per year

ts_exchange.Name: ts_exchange
ts_exchange.Description: will add the timeseries exchange ID in case it exists

ts_spacing.Name: ts_spacing
ts_spacing.Description: value spacing of equidistant timeseries as ISO period

ts_clientvalue##.Name: ts_clientvalue##
ts_clientvalue##.Description: timeseries client values reaching from 1-10, e.g. ts_clientvalue4

datacart.Name: datacart
datacart.Description: use this fieldname to retrieve the result as a full 'Datacart', other entries will be ignored if existent

ca_site.Name: ca_site
ca_site.Description: returns custom site attributes, optionally use parameter ca_site_returnfields to select specific fields

ca_sta.Name: ca_sta
ca_sta.Description: returns custom station attributes, optionally use parameter ca_sta_returnfields to select specific fields

ca_par.Name: ca_par
ca_par.Description: returns custom parameter attributes, optionally use parameter ca_par_returnfields to select specific fields

ca_ts.Name: ca_ts
ca_ts.Description: returns custom timeseries attributes, optionally use parameter ca_ts_returnfields to select specific fields

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

dateformat.Name: dateformat
dateformat.Description: the date format that will be returned, see date formats

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be returned for all timestamps, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET)

ca_site_returnfields.Name: ca_site_returnfields
ca_site_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined site attributes (returnfield 'ca_site' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_sta_returnfields.Name: ca_sta_returnfields
ca_sta_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined station attributes (returnfield 'ca_sta' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_par_returnfields.Name: ca_par_returnfields
ca_par_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined parameter attributes (returnfield 'ca_par' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_ts_returnfields.Name: ca_ts_returnfields
ca_ts_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined timeseries attributes (returnfield 'ca_ts' must be active, allows comma separated list)

addlinks.Name: addlinks
addlinks.Description: adds links for easier data discovery to the response

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

orderby.Name: orderby
orderby.Description: Sort the response by one of the following fields: station_name, ts_shortname, ts_id, station_id, stationparameter_name, station_no, parametertype_name, ts_name, stationparameter_no, ts_path, stationparameter_longname, from, to

tabjson.Name: tabjson
tabjson.Description: JSON format to reflect table structure

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

getTimeseriesValues.Subdescription: The following combinations of time periods can be requested:;from + to: will return the requested range;from + period: will return the given period starting at the from date;to + period: will return the given period backdating from the to date;period: will return the given period backdating from the current system time;period=complete: will return the complete coverage of all requested timeseries;from: will return all data starting at the given from date until the current system time;to: will return all data of the timeseries until the given to date;futureperiod: will return the given period starting from the current system time;period + futureperiod: will return the combined given periods from the past and the future;from + futureperiod: will return the combined given period starting at the given from date until the end of the future period starting at the current system time;changedSince: will return all data of the timeseries changed since the given date (requires active ts edit history in WISKI)

ts_id.Name: ts_id
ts_id.Description: either ts_id or timeseriesgroup_id or ts_path can be used; one or more transformations may be concatenated to each ID with a semicolon, e.g. ts_id=123;factor(3.0)

ts_path.Name: ts_path
ts_path.Description: the timeseries path according to WISKI7; a single path with placeholders may be used or a comma separated list without placeholders; either ts_id or timeseriesgroup_id or ts_path can be used; one or more transformations may be concatenated to each path with a semicolon, e.g. ts_path=a/b/c/d;factor(3.0)

timeseriesgroup_id.Name: timeseriesgroup_id
timeseriesgroup_id.Description: either ts_id or timeseriesgroup_id or ts_path can be used

from.Name: from
from.Description: see date formats, not providing 'from' delivers the last ts value only

to.Name: to
to.Description: see date formats, using yyyy-MM-dd as format includes the complete given day

period.Name: period
period.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar; as an alternative period can be set to 'complete' to return all data

futureperiod.Name: futureperiod
futureperiod.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar

changedsince.Name: changedsince
changedsince.Description: see date formats, will return all data of the timeseries changed since the given date (requires active ts edit history in WISKI); may be combined with period to limit data retrieval from the past

dajson.Name: dajson
dajson.Description: Optimised data array JSON format for timeseries values

zrxp.Name: zrxp
zrxp.Description: KISTERS ZRXP format with basic content

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description:
Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)
Please note that transformation results will have fixed automatic returnfields, only additional quality, release state and comment columns can be selected.

Value.Name: Value
Value.Description: Default value column if present in the timeseries

Aggregation Accuracy.Name: Aggregation Accuracy
Aggregation Accuracy.Description: Percentage of not missing/good values for aggregation timeseries

Absolute Value.Name: Absolute Value
Absolute Value.Description: Absolute value column if present in the timeseries

Runoff Value.Name: Runoff Value
Runoff Value.Description: Runoff value column if present in the timeseries

Stagesource Value.Name: Stagesource Value
Stagesource Value.Description: Stagesource value column if present in the timeseries

Occurrance Timestamp.Name: Occurrance Timestamp
Occurrance Timestamp.Description: Time of occurrance for statistical values (e.g. time of the monthly max)

Timeseries Comment.Name: Timeseries Comment
Timeseries Comment.Description: Any comments written at the timeseries level, separated with a ';'

Agent Comment.Name: Agent Comment
Agent Comment.Description: Any comments written at the agent level, separated with a ';'

Station Comment.Name: Station Comment
Station Comment.Description: Any comments written at the station level, separated with a ';'

Parameter Comment.Name: Parameter Comment
Parameter Comment.Description: Any comments written at the parameter level, separated with a ';'

Data Comment.Name: Data Comment
Data Comment.Description: Any comments written at the data level, separated with a ';'

Release State.Name: Release State
Release State.Description: Any release states written at the data level, separated with a ';'

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

metadata.Name: metadata
metadata.Description: set metadata=true to add more metadata fields to responses

md_returnfields.Name: md_returnfields
md_returnfields.Description: specify exactly which metadata fields should be returned; available fields: ts_id, ts_path, ts_name, ts_shortname, station_no, station_id, station_latitude, station_longitude, station_carteasting, station_cartnorthing, station_local_x, station_local_y, station_name, stationparameter_name, stationparameter_no, stationparameter_longname, ts_unitname, ts_unitsymbol, ts_unitname_abs, ts_unitsymbol_abs, parametertype_id, parametertype_name, ts_exchange, ts_precision, station_longname, site_id, site_no, site_name, catchment_id, catchment_no, catchment_name, ensembledate, ensembledispatchinfo, timezone (the timezone of the values), ts_spacing, ts_clientvalue## (client values 1-10), river_name, custom_attributes (deprecated - use ca_sta), ca_site (custom site attributes), ca_sta (custom station attributes), ca_par (custom parameter attributes), ca_ts (custom timeseries attributes)

ca_site_returnfields.Name: ca_site_returnfields
ca_site_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined site attributes (md_returnfield 'ca_site' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_sta_returnfields.Name: ca_sta_returnfields
ca_sta_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined station attributes (md_returnfield 'ca_sta' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_par_returnfields.Name: ca_par_returnfields
ca_par_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined parameter attributes (md_returnfield 'ca_par' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_ts_returnfields.Name: ca_ts_returnfields
ca_ts_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined timeseries attributes (md_returnfield 'ca_ts' must be active, allows comma separated list)

dateformat.Name: dateformat
dateformat.Description: the date format that will be returned, see date formats

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be returned for all timestamps, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET) or 'individual' to use individual timeseries timezones

crs.Name: crs
crs.Description: set crs=webmercator to retrieve position data in webmercator projection (only applies for esrijson format)

valueorder.Name: valueorder
valueorder.Description: sets the order in which the values will be returned, asc/ascending or desc/descending; default is ascending

useprecision.Name: useprecision
useprecision.Description: advises KiWIS to use the WISKI precision for value formatting, true or false; default is true

valuelocale.Name: valuelocale
valuelocale.Description: sets the locale in which the values will be formatted; default is en; for de, csvDiv will automatically be ';', all json formats will use locale en; only applies if useprecision=true

valuesasstring.Name: valuesasstring
valuesasstring.Description: advises KiWIS to return timeseries values in JSON as string instead of number, true or false; default is false

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

forcecontentdisposition.Name: forcecontentdisposition
forcecontentdisposition.Description: setting this to true advises KiWIS to set a content disposition header for all formats, triggering the browser to offer a download

getensembletimestampsonly.Name: getensembletimestampsonly
getensembletimestampsonly.Description: can only be used if all ts_ids are ensemble timeseries and will return a list of available fore-/hindcast timestamps without values; cannot be used for wml2 format

sincefirstchange.Name: sincefirstchange
sincefirstchange.Description: only active for the changedsince filter; retrieves all data since the first changed timestamp without gaps

locationascolumns.Name: locationascolumns
locationascolumns.Description: setting this to true, adds lat/lon fields as column to every value; will be ignored for WML2 and ZRXP format

minquality.Name: minquality
minquality.Description: minimum quality (0-255), values with lower value (higher quality) will be removed (not applicable for transformation results)

maxquality.Name: maxquality
maxquality.Description: maximum quality (0-255), values with higher value (lower quality) will be removed (not applicable for transformation results)

qualitylist.Name: qualitylist
qualitylist.Description: comma separated list of exact quality codes, values with any other quality will be removed (not applicable for transformation results)

gapdetection.Name: gapdetection
gapdetection.Description: detects and fills gaps with missings in equidistant timeseries (cannot be used with: last values, ensembles, transformation results, changedSince); Possible values: fillgaps - fills detected gaps between existing values, fillrange - fills the whole requested time range so that there either is a valid value or a missing for each timestamp, markgaps - marks detected gaps between existing values by inserting one missing at the beginning and one missing at the end of each gap

enhanceborders.Name: enhanceborders
enhanceborders.Description: setting this to true, tries to extend the retrieved time range per timeseries to include border values for graph display (cannot be used with: changedSince, will be ignored for ensembles and last values)

commentlanguage.Name: commentlanguage
commentlanguage.Description: the language of comments based on standard remark types that will be returned, default is 'en'

excelsheetlabel.Name: excelsheetlabel
excelsheetlabel.Description: pattern for the excel sheet label: default (ts_path), nosite (ts_path without site), par_ts (only parameter and timeseries part of the path), par (parameter only), ts (timeseries only)

usewiskiqualityformissings.Name: usewiskiqualityformissings
usewiskiqualityformissings.Description: if set to true, will use the WISKI quality code 255 for missings instead of -1; only applies to zrxp format

transformation.Name: transformation
transformation.Description: the transformation to use; only applies for requests with timeseriesgroup_id filter and appends the transformation to all timeseries of all groups

Content.name: Aggregate
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, yearly, year, monthly, month, daily, day, hourly, hour
Aggregation Types (MANDATORY LIST): min, max, mean, average, total, counts, perc-#

Content.name: Factor
Content.description: Multiplies each value by the specified factor and optionally sets a new unit (does not affect the unit fields in KiWIS!)

Content.name: Moving Total
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, decade, year, yearly, month, monthly, day, daily, hour, hourly

Content.name: Primary Statistics
Content.description: Builds a single statistical value. Mode 'por' is default.
attributes: Statistical Value (MANDATORY): min, max, mean, average, total, sum, perc-#

Content.name: Cumulate
Content.description: Cumulates the data until the end of the interval is reached and starts with the next value again. If no interval is given, cumulation will be done for all values.
attributes: Interval (OPTIONAL): HHMMSS, decade, year, month, day, hour

Content.name: Moving Average
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, decade, year, yearly, month, monthly, day, daily, hour, hourly

Content.name: Moving Maximum
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, decade, year, yearly, month, monthly, day, daily, hour, hourly

Content.name: Moving Minimum
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, decade, year, yearly, month, monthly, day, daily, hour, hourly

Content.name: Moving Standard Deviation
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, decade, year, yearly, month, monthly, day, daily, hour, hourly

Content.name: BoxWhisker
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, decade, year, yearly, month, monthly, day, daily, hour, hourly
Method (OPTIONAL): excel, hazen, sasd4, sasd5, vdi

Content.name: Maximum
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, yearly, monthly, weekly, daily, hourly

Content.name: Minimum
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, yearly, monthly, weekly, daily, hourly

Content.name: Total
attributes: Interval (MANDATORY): HHMMSS, decadal, yearly, monthly, weekly, daily, hourly

Content.name: Aggregation Interval
Content.description: Defines the aggregation interval for subsequent transformations.
attributes: Aggregation Start (MANDATORY): Relative or absolute time- "(0)-(0)-(0)T(0):(0):(0)" / yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss, decadal, yearly, year, monthly, month, daily, day, hourly, hour, hydrology, meteorology

getTimeseriesValueLayer.Description: Retrieves a layer of timeseries values for a given date including location data.

ts_id.Name: ts_id
ts_id.Description: either ts_id, ts_path, timeseriesgroup_id or bbox can be used

ts_path.Name: ts_path
ts_path.Description: the timeseries path according to WISKI7; a single path with placeholders may be used or a comma separated list without placeholders; either ts_id, ts_path, timeseriesgroup_id or bbox can be used

timeseriesgroup_id.Name: timeseriesgroup_id
timeseriesgroup_id.Description: either ts_id, ts_path, timeseriesgroup_id or bbox can be used

bbox.Name: bbox
bbox.Description: either ts_id, ts_path, timeseriesgroup_id or bbox can be used; comma separated list with four values in order min_x, min_y, max_x, max_y; use 'crs' parameter to choose between local and global coordinates; fields stationparameter_no and ts_shortname are required for bbox; the function will select 0 or 1 timeseries per station in the area according to filters

stationparameter_no.Name: stationparameter_no
stationparameter_no.Description: with bbox filter only; if multiple values are given the order will be considered for timeseries selection

ts_shortname.Name: ts_shortname
ts_shortname.Description: with bbox filter only; if multiple values are given the order will be considered for timeseries selection

date.Name: date
date.Description: the date to request values for, see date formats

valuecolumn.Name: valuecolumn
valuecolumn.Description: the value column to use for output; valid values are: default, absolute, runoff, stagesource, ReturnPeriod

site_no.Name: site_no
site_no.Description: can be used to additionally filter for sites

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

req_timestamp.Name: req_timestamp
req_timestamp.Description: Timestamp as sent in the date parameter

occ_timestamp.Name: occ_timestamp
occ_timestamp.Description: Timestamp of occurance for statistics timeseries

occ_count.Name: occ_count
occ_count.Description: Count of occurance for statistics timeseries

sta_location.Name: sta_location
sta_location.Description: Station coordinates with consideration of the crs paramter

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

metadata.Name: metadata
metadata.Description: set metadata=true to add more metadata fields to responses

md_returnfields.Name: md_returnfields
md_returnfields.Description: specify exactly which metadata fields should be returned; available fields: ts_id, ts_path, ts_name, ts_shortname, station_no, station_id, station_name, stationparameter_name, stationparameter_no, stationparameter_longname, ts_unitname, ts_unitsymbol, ts_unitname_abs, ts_unitsymbol_abs, parametertype_id, parametertype_name, station_longname, custom_attributes (deprecated - use ca_sta), station_count (adds a field containing the number of duplicate stations per entry), aggaccuracy_percent (adds percentage of not missing/good values for aggregation timeseries), timezone (the timezone of the values), group_item_order (only for one group), site_id, site_no, site_name, catchment_id, catchment_no, catchment_name, object_type, object_type_shortname, station_area_wkt, station_area_wkt_org, ts_clientvalue## (client values 1-10), ca_site (custom site attributes), ca_sta (custom station attributes), ca_par (custom parameter attributes), ca_ts (custom timeseries attributes)

ca_site_returnfields.Name: ca_site_returnfields
ca_site_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined site attributes (md_returnfield 'ca_site' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_sta_returnfields.Name: ca_sta_returnfields
ca_sta_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined station attributes (md_returnfield 'ca_sta' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_par_returnfields.Name: ca_par_returnfields
ca_par_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined parameter attributes (md_returnfield 'ca_par' must be active, allows comma separated list)

ca_ts_returnfields.Name: ca_ts_returnfields
ca_ts_returnfields.Description: selects a set of custom defined timeseries attributes (md_returnfield 'ca_ts' must be active, allows comma separated list)

dateformat.Name: dateformat
dateformat.Description: the date format that will be returned, see date formats

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be returned for all timestamps, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET)

crs.Name: crs
crs.Description: set to 'localxy', 'regional' or 'global' to use the local, regional or global station reference system, set to 'webmercator' to retrieve position data in webmercator projection (only applies for esrijson format and uses global station coordinates for calculation)

orderby.Name: orderby
orderby.Description: sorts the result set by the given field, this can be helpful e.g. for drawing order in a map; available fields: value, timestamp, station_name, station_no, group_item_order (only with one group)

orderdir.Name: orderdir
orderdir.Description: sets the sort direction, only usable together with 'orderby'; possible values: asc, desc; default is ascending

invalidperiod.Name: invalidperiod
invalidperiod.Description: sets the deviation period between requested and returned timestamp to determine which values will be invalidated, must be used together with 'invalidvalue'; can be used like the normal period parameter for other requests

invalidvalue.Name: invalidvalue
invalidvalue.Description: sets the value that will be inserted for invalids, must be used together with 'invalidperiod'; any numeric value can be used

showemptytimeseries.Name: showemptytimeseries
showemptytimeseries.Description: sets if timeseries without a value should be removed or shown in the layer; default is true

hidetsid.Name: hidetsid
hidetsid.Description: sets if timeseries ids should be hidden or shown in the layer; default is false; DEPRECATED - use returnfields instead

useprecision.Name: useprecision
useprecision.Description: advises KiWIS to use the WISKI precision for value formatting, true or false; default is true

valuelocale.Name: valuelocale
valuelocale.Description: sets the locale in which the values will be formatted; default is en; for de, csvDiv will automatically be ';', all json formats will use locale en; only applies if useprecision=true

valuesasstring.Name: valuesasstring
valuesasstring.Description: advises KiWIS to return timeseries values in JSON as string instead of number, true or false; default is false

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

getGraphTemplateList.Description: Retrieves a list of stored graph templates with metadata.

templategroup.Name: templategroup
templategroup.Description: optionally select a group (sub-directory) for stored templates

tabjson.Name: tabjson
tabjson.Description: JSON format to reflect table structure

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

getGraph.Description: Retrieves a graph image of timeseries data.
getGraph.Subdescription: The following combinations of time periods can be requested:;from + to: will return the requested range;from + period: will return the given period starting at the from date;to + period: will return the given period backdating from the to date;period: will return the given period backdating from the current system time;period=complete: will return the complete coverage of all requested timeseries;from: will return all data starting at the given from date until the current system time;futureperiod: will return the given period starting from the current system time;period + futureperiod: will return the combined given periods from the past and the future;from + futureperiod: will return the combined given period starting at the given from date until the end of the future period starting at the current system time

ts_id.Name: ts_id
ts_id.Description: either ts_id or ts_path can be used

ext_ts_id.Name: ext_ts_id
ext_ts_id.Description: additional ts ids for usage with the placeholder mechanism in templates; either ext_ts_id or ext_ts_path can be used

ts_path.Name: ts_path
ts_path.Description: either ts_id or ts_path can be used

ext_ts_path.Name: ext_ts_path
ext_ts_path.Description: additional ts paths for usage with the placeholder mechanism in templates; either ext_ts_id or ext_ts_path can be used

from.Name: from
from.Description: see date formats, not providing 'from' delivers the last ts value only

to.Name: to
to.Description: see date formats, using yyyy-MM-dd as format includes the complete given day

period.Name: period
period.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar; as an alternative period can be set to 'complete' to return all data

futureperiod.Name: futureperiod
futureperiod.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar

template.Name: template
template.Description: use a stored template for graph design

templategroup.Name: templategroup
templategroup.Description: optionally select a group (sub-directory) for a stored template

showgroups.Name: showgroups
showgroups.Description: select specific object groups to be visible in the graph; only applies for template graphs and the template must have groups specified

hidelegend.Name: hidelegend
hidelegend.Description: true|false - overwrites or sets the hide-legend flag for template graphs

overlayinterval.Name: overlayinterval
overlayinterval.Description: set the overlay interval to year, month, week, day or halfyear; only applies for template graphs where the template contains overlaid setting for one timeseries

overlayslices.Name: overlayslices
overlayslices.Description: select the slices that will be shown, e.g. 0,1,2 will show the first three years if interval is year; only applies for template graphs where the template contains overlaid setting for one timeseries

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

renderer.Name: renderer
renderer.Description: supported values: XYTsRenderer, XYAreaRenderer, XYBarRenderer, XYLineAndShapeRenderer, XYStepAreaRenderer, YIntervalRenderer; does not apply for template graphs

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be used in graph, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET); if a zone is already defined in a template, it will NOT be overriden

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

forcecontentdisposition.Name: forcecontentdisposition
forcecontentdisposition.Description: setting this to true advises KiWIS to set a content disposition header for all formats, triggering the browser to offer a download

getStationGraph.Description: Retrieves a graph image of timeseries data based on stations with a template.
getStationGraph.Subdescription: The following combinations of time periods can be requested:;from + to: will return the requested range;from + period: will return the given period starting at the from date;to + period: will return the given period backdating from the to date;period: will return the given period backdating from the current system time;period=complete: will return the complete coverage of all requested timeseries;from: will return all data starting at the given from date until the current system time;futureperiod: will return the given period starting from the current system time;period + futureperiod: will return the combined given periods from the past and the future;from + futureperiod: will return the combined given period starting at the given from date until the end of the future period starting at the current system time

from.Name: from
from.Description: see date formats, not providing 'from' delivers the last ts value only

to.Name: to
to.Description: see date formats, using yyyy-MM-dd as format includes the complete given day

period.Name: period
period.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar; as an alternative period can be set to 'complete' to return all data

futureperiod.Name: futureperiod
futureperiod.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar

template.Name: template
template.Description: select a stored template for station graph design, mandatory

templategroup.Name: templategroup
templategroup.Description: optionally select a group (sub-directory) for a stored template

showgroups.Name: showgroups
showgroups.Description: select specific object groups to be visible in the graph; only applies for template graphs and the template must have groups specified

hidelegend.Name: hidelegend
hidelegend.Description: true|false - overwrites or sets the hide-legend flag for template graphs

overlayinterval.Name: overlayinterval
overlayinterval.Description: set the overlay interval to year, month, week, day or halfyear; only applies for template graphs where the template contains overlaid setting for one timeseries

overlayslices.Name: overlayslices
overlayslices.Description: select the slices that will be shown, e.g. 0,1,2 will show the first three years if interval is year; only applies for template graphs where the template contains overlaid setting for one timeseries

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be used in graph, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET); if a zone is already defined in a template, it will NOT be overriden

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

forcecontentdisposition.Name: forcecontentdisposition
forcecontentdisposition.Description: setting this to true advises KiWIS to set a content disposition header for all formats, triggering the browser to offer a download

getColorClassifications.Description: Retrieves a list of WISKI color classifications.

parameterType.Name: parameterType
parameterType.Description: The parameter type the classification is defined for

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

getQualityCodes.Description: Retrieves the list of WISKI quality codes.

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

getReleaseStateClasses.Description: Retrieves the list of WISKI release state classes.

tabjson.Name: tabjson
tabjson.Description: JSON format to reflect table structure

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

getTimeseriesReleaseStateList.Description: Retrieves a list of timeseries release states.
getTimeseriesReleaseStateList.Subdescription: The following combinations of time periods can be requested:;from + to: will return the requested range;from + period: will return the given period starting at the from date;to + period: will return the given period backdating from the to date;period: will return the given period backdating from the current system time;from: will return all data starting at the given from date until the current system time;to: will return all data of the timeseries until the given to date;futureperiod: will return the given period starting from the current system time;period + futureperiod: will return the combined given periods from the past and the future;from + futureperiod: will return the combined given period starting at the given from date until the end of the future period starting at the current system time

ts_id.Name: ts_id
ts_id.Description: either ts_id or ts_path can be used

ts_path.Name: ts_path
ts_path.Description: the timeseries path according to WISKI7; either ts_id or ts_path can be used

from.Name: from
from.Description: see date formats, not providing 'from' delivers the last ts value only

to.Name: to
to.Description: see date formats, using yyyy-MM-dd as format includes the complete given day

period.Name: period
period.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar

futureperiod.Name: futureperiod
futureperiod.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

dateformat.Name: dateformat
dateformat.Description: the date format that will be returned, see date formats

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be returned for all timestamps, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET)

getTimeseriesEnsembleValues.Description: Retrieves a list of timeseries ensembles with values for one or more timeseries.
getTimeseriesEnsembleValues.Subdescription: The following combinations of time periods can be requested:;from + to: will return the requested range;from + period: will return the given period starting at the from date;to + period: will return the given period backdating from the to date;period: will return the given period backdating from the current system time;from: will return all data starting at the given from date until the current system time;to: will return all data of the timeseries until the given to date;futureperiod: will return the given period starting from the current system time;period + futureperiod: will return the combined given periods from the past and the future;from + futureperiod: will return the combined given period starting at the given from date until the end of the future period starting at the current system time

ts_id.Name: ts_id
ts_id.Description: either ts_id, ts_path or timeseriesgroup_id can be used

ts_path.Name: ts_path
ts_path.Description: the timeseries path according to WISKI7; a single path with placeholders may be used or a comma separated list without placeholders; either ts_id, ts_path or timeseriesgroup_id can be used

timeseriesgroup_id.Name: timeseriesgroup_id
timeseriesgroup_id.Description: either ts_id or timeseriesgroup_id or ts_path can be used

from.Name: from
from.Description: see date formats, not providing 'from' delivers the last ts value only

to.Name: to
to.Description: see date formats, using yyyy-MM-dd as format includes the complete given day

period.Name: period
period.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar

futureperiod.Name: futureperiod
futureperiod.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar

ensembledispatchinfo.Name: ensembledispatchinfo
ensembledispatchinfo.Description: the dispatch info for which ensembles should be returned

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

dateformat.Name: dateformat
dateformat.Description: the date format that will be returned, see date formats

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be returned for all timestamps, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET)

useprecision.Name: useprecision
useprecision.Description: advises KiWIS to use the WISKI precision for value formatting, true or false; default is true

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

getTimeseriesChanges.Description: Retrieves a list of changes for a timeseries.
getTimeseriesChanges.Subdescription: By default, this is feature is only available for import timeseries in WISKI. For any other timeseries, the tsEditHistory has to be activated.

ts_id.Name: ts_id
ts_id.Description: either ts_id or ts_path can be used

ts_path.Name: ts_path
ts_path.Description: the timeseries path according to WISKI7; a single path without placeholders may be used; either ts_id or ts_path can be used

tabjson.Name: tabjson
tabjson.Description: JSON format to reflect table structure

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

dateformat.Name: dateformat
dateformat.Description: the date format that will be returned, see date formats

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be returned for all timestamps, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET)

optimizechanges.Name: optimizechanges
optimizechanges.Description: Changes will be optimized, meaning that interconnected changes for equidistant timeseries will be merged by KiWIS at the cost of losing the change_time

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

getTimeseriesComments.Description: Retrieves object comments/remarks on timeseries level.
getTimeseriesComments.Subdescription: The following combinations of time periods can be requested:;from + to: will return the requested range;from + period: will return the given period starting at the from date;to + period: will return the given period backdating from the to date;period: will return the given period backdating from the current system time;period=complete: will return the complete coverage of all requested timeseries;from: will return all data starting at the given from date until the current system time;to: will return all data of the timeseries until the given to date;futureperiod: will return the given period starting from the current system time;period + futureperiod: will return the combined given periods from the past and the future;from + futureperiod: will return the combined given period starting at the given from date until the end of the future period starting at the current system time

ts_id.Name: ts_id
ts_id.Description: either ts_id or ts_path can be used

ts_path.Name: ts_path
ts_path.Description: the timeseries path according to WISKI7; a single path with placeholders may be used or a comma separated list without placeholders; either ts_id or ts_path can be used

comment_type.Name: comment_type
comment_type.Description: Retrieve comments for object types station, parameter, timeseries, data, agent or use the keyword all to get all types

from.Name: from
from.Description: see date formats, not providing 'from' delivers the last ts value only

to.Name: to
to.Description: see date formats, using yyyy-MM-dd as format includes the complete given day

period.Name: period
period.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar; as an alternative period can be set to 'complete' to return all data

futureperiod.Name: futureperiod
futureperiod.Description: retrieve data for a time period according to ISO format P#Y#M#DT#H#M#S where P just indicates an arbitrary period with the # being integers; the entities are: Y=Year, M=Month, D=Day, T just indicates that smaller entities are included, H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second; W=Week is also supported but mutually exclusive with D=Day setting; Examples: P3D, P1Y, P1DT12H, PT6H, P1Y6M3DT4H20M30S; all periods are applied by calendar

tabjson.Name: tabjson
tabjson.Description: JSON format to reflect table structure

objson.Name: objson
objson.Description: JSON format to reflect object structure

xlsx.Name: xlsx
xlsx.Description: Excel 2007+ format with number and date cell types; due to cell formating, production time quickly increases with the number of rows and columns

Returnfields.Description: Returnable fields as optional parameter 'returnfields' (allows comma separated list)

from.Name: from
from.Description: Valid from timestamp of the comment/remark

to.Name: to
to.Description: Valid to timestamp of the comment/remark

comment_type.Name: comment_type
comment_type.Description: The object the comment/remark is attached to

std_remark_shortname.Name: std_remark_shortname
std_remark_shortname.Description: Shortname of the linked standard remark type for standard remarks

std_remark_text.Name: std_remark_text
std_remark_text.Description: Text of the linked standard remark type for standard remarks

csvdiv.Name: csvdiv
csvdiv.Description: overwrite the standard CSV delimiter (;) with another symbol in CSV requests

dateformat.Name: dateformat
dateformat.Description: the date format that will be returned, see date formats

timezone.Name: timezone
timezone.Description: the time zone that will be returned for all timestamps, any time zone string as understood by Java (e.g. GMT+5, UTC, CET) or 'individual' to use individual timeseries timezones

downloadaszip.Name: downloadaszip
downloadaszip.Description: provides the result as a ZIP file containing a file in the selected format

downloadfilename.Name: downloadfilename
downloadfilename.Description: sets the file name if downloadaszip=true is set or CSV and Excel downloads are requested, default name is generic per request

commentlanguage.Name: commentlanguage
commentlanguage.Description: The language of comments based on standard remark types that will be returned, default is 'en'

checkValueLimit.Description: Checks value limitations for time range value requests.

ts_id.Description: either ts_id or timeseriesgroup_id or ts_path can be used
